New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers improved to 32-4, the best record in the NBA through 36 games; The game ended with 30 lead changes and was the third meeting between teams with double-digit winning streaks since 1995
Key Match Events: Mobley's crucial 10-footer with 1:19 left after a reversed foul call sealed the win; The game had a high intensity with neither team leading by more than nine points
Pre-Game Insights: The game was anticipated as a potential Finals matchup; Both teams entered with strong winning streaks, making it a rare and high-stakes encounter
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland showed depth and resilience despite Mitchell's off performance; Oklahoma City's star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander continued to shine but couldn't lead his team to victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 11 and dominated the Western Conference; The Thunder's first loss since December 1 ended their 15-game streak
Others: The game's significance was highlighted by its competitive nature and the teams' strong records; The Cavaliers' home dominance was emphasized
